metadata.dc:author: Fonck, M L
Vergara, F
metadata.dc:description: Headache and facial pain are frequent complaints. The underlying process is most often benign but serious conditions may be present requiring an urgent diagnostic approach. A careful history including psychologic evaluation and a meticulous neurologic examination are essential for an adequate selection of complementary laboratory testing.
metadata.dc:title: Diagn√≥stico diferencial de las cefaleas y algias faciales.
[Differential diagnosis of headache and facial pain].
